00028 /* Includes ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00029 #include "ht32.h"
00030 #include "ht32_board.h"

00045 /* Private function prototypes -----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00046 void RTC_Configuration(void);
00047 u32 Time_Regulate(void);
00048 void Time_Display(u32 wTimeVar);
00049 u32 ScanUnsignedDecimal(void);

00051 /* Private variables ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00052 vu32 gwTimeDisplay = 0;
00053 
00054 /* Global functions ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00055 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00056   * @brief  Main program.
00057   * @retval None
00058   * @note At this stage the microcontroller clock setting is already configured,
00059   *       this is done through SystemInit() function which is called from startup
00060   *       file (startup_ht32fxxxx.s) before branching to application main.
00061   *       To reconfigure the default setting of SystemInit() function, refer to
00062   *       system_ht32fxxxx.c file
00063   * @details Main program as following:
00064   *   - Enable RTC PCLK and waits until it can be accessed.
00065   *     The RTC is located in backup domain.
00066   *     And the isolation is enabled when backup domain reset,
00067   *     Therefore you have to disable isolation via PWRCU_CheckReadyAccessed() API.
00068   *   - Init LED1 and USART.
00069   *   - Enable NVIC RTC interrupt.
00070   *   - Check the PWRCU flags and PWRCU_BAKREG_0 register.
00071   *     - Print Backup Domain Power On Reset information
00072   *       when the first time the program is executed.
00073   *     - If PWRCU_BAKREG_0 register value is not correct or not yet programmed
00074   *       (when the first time the program is executed).
00075   *       - RTC Configuration via RTC_Configuration function.
00076   *         The RTC counter will restart when match event occurred.
00077   *       - Adjust time by values entered by the user on the hyperterminal
00078   *         via Time_Regulate function. Then store the init time to PWRCU_BAKREG_1.
00079   *       - Write 0xA5A5 to PWRCU_BAKREG_0.
00080   *       - Enable RTC
00081   *     - If PWRCU_BAKREG_0 register value correct:
00082   *       this means that the RTC is configured and the time is displayed on HyperTerminal.
00083   *   - Display current time in infinite loop.
00084   *     Current time is sum of the RTC counter value and the init time(stored in PWRCU_BAKREG_1 register).
00085   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00086 int main(void)
00087 {
00088   /* Enable Backup Domain PCLK and waits until it can be accessed                                           */
00089   CKCU_PeripClockConfig_TypeDef CKCUClock = {{0}};
00090   CKCUClock.Bit.BKP        = 1;
00091   CKCU_PeripClockConfig(CKCUClock, ENABLE);
00092   if (PWRCU_CheckReadyAccessed() != PWRCU_OK)
00093   {
00094     while (1);
00095   }
00096 
00097   /* Init LED1 and USART                                                                                    */
00098   HT32F_DVB_LEDInit(HT_LED1);
00099 
00100   RETARGET_Configuration();           /* Retarget Related configuration                                     */
00101 
00102   /* Enable NVIC RTC interrupt                                                                              */
00103   NVIC_EnableIRQ(RTC_IRQn);
00104 
00105   /* Check if the Power On Reset flag is set                                                                */
00106   if (PWRCU_GetFlagStatus() == PWRCU_FLAG_PWRPOR)
00107   {
00108     printf("\r\n\n Power On Reset occurred....");
00109   }
00110 
00111   if (PWRCU_ReadBackupRegister(PWRCU_BAKREG_0) != 0xA55A)
00112   {
00113     u32 wInitTime = 0;
00114     /* Backup data register value is not correct or not yet programmed (when
00115        the first time the program is executed) */
00116 
00117     printf("\r\n\n RTC not yet configured....");
00118 
00119     /* RTC Configuration                                                                                    */
00120     RTC_Configuration();
00121 
00122     printf("\r\n RTC configured....");
00123 
00124     /* Adjust time by values entered by the user on the hyperterminal,
00125        Then store the init time to PWRCU_BAKREG_1. */
00126     wInitTime = Time_Regulate();
00127     PWRCU_WriteBackupRegister(PWRCU_BAKREG_1, wInitTime);
00128 
00129     PWRCU_WriteBackupRegister(PWRCU_BAKREG_0, 0xA55A);
00130 
00131     /* Enable RTC                                                                                           */
00132     RTC_Cmd(ENABLE);
00133   }
00134   else
00135   {
00136     printf("\r\n No need to configure RTC....");
00137   }
00138 
00139   /* Display current time in infinite loop                                                                  */
00140   printf("\r\n");
00141 
00142   while (1)
00143   {
00144     /* If 1s has passed                                                                                     */
00145     if (gwTimeDisplay == 1)
00146     {
00147       /* Display current time.
00148          Current time is sum of the RTC counter value and the init time(stored in PWRCU_BAKREG_1 register).
00149          The init time (PWRCU_BAKREG_1 register) will be clear if the RTC Match flag(CMFLAG) is set.
00150          Refer to RTC_IRQHandler. */
00151       Time_Display(RTC_GetCounter() + PWRCU_ReadBackupRegister(PWRCU_BAKREG_1));
00152       gwTimeDisplay = 0;
00153     }
00154   }
00155 }
00156 
00157 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00158  * @brief Configures the RTC.
00159  * @retval None
00160  * @details RTC configuration as following:
00161  *  - S/W reset backup domain.
00162  *  - Configure Low Speed External clock (LSE).
00163  *    - The LSE use fast startup mode.
00164  *      Shortly startup time but higher power consumption.
00165  *    - Enable the LSE.
00166  *    - Waits till LSE is ready.
00167  *  - Configure RTC.
00168  *    - Select LSE as RTC Clock Source.
00169  *    - Enable the RTC Second interrupt.
00170  *    - RTC prescaler = 32768 to generate 1 second interrupt.
00171  *    - Enable clear RTC counter by match function.
00172  *
00173  ************************************************************************************************************/
00174 void RTC_Configuration(void)
00175 {
00176   /* Reset Backup Domain                                                                                    */
00177   PWRCU_DeInit();
00178 
00179   /* Configure Low Speed External clock (LSE)                                                               */
00180   RTC_LSESMConfig(RTC_LSESM_FAST);
00181   RTC_LSECmd(ENABLE);
00182   while (CKCU_GetClockReadyStatus(CKCU_FLAG_LSERDY) == RESET);
00183 
00184   /* Configure the RTC                                                                                      */
00185   RTC_ClockSourceConfig(RTC_SRC_LSE);
00186   RTC_IntConfig(RTC_INT_CSEC, ENABLE);
00187   RTC_SetPrescaler(RTC_RPRE_32768);
00188 }
00189 
00190 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00191   * @brief  Returns the time entered by user, using Hyperterminal.
00192   * @return Enter time, unit is second within a day.
00193   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00194 u32 Time_Regulate(void)
00195 {
00196   u32 Tmp_HH = 0xFF, Tmp_MM = 0xFF, Tmp_SS = 0xFF;
00197 
00198   printf("\r\n==============Time Settings=====================================");
00199   printf("\r\n  Please Set Hours");
00200   printf("\r\n");
00201   do
00202   {
00203     Tmp_HH = ScanUnsignedDecimal();
00204   } while (Tmp_HH > 23);
00205   printf(":  %u", (unsigned int)Tmp_HH);
00206 
00207   printf("\r\n  Please Set Minutes");
00208   printf("\r\n");
00209   do
00210   {
00211     Tmp_MM = ScanUnsignedDecimal();
00212   } while (Tmp_MM > 59);
00213   printf(":  %u", (unsigned int)Tmp_MM);
00214 
00215   printf("\r\n  Please Set Seconds");
00216   printf("\r\n");
00217   do
00218   {
00219     Tmp_SS = ScanUnsignedDecimal();
00220   } while (Tmp_SS > 59);
00221   printf(":  %u", (unsigned int)Tmp_SS);
00222 
00223   return((Tmp_HH * 3600 + Tmp_MM * 60 + Tmp_SS));
00224 }
00225 
00226 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00227   * @brief  Displays the input time.
00228   * @param  wTimeVar: Displays time.
00229   * @retval None
00230   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00231 void Time_Display(u32 wTimeVar)
00232 {
00233   u32 THH = 0, TMM = 0, TSS = 0;
00234 
00235   wTimeVar %= 86400;
00236 
00237   /* Compute  hours                                                                                         */
00238   THH = wTimeVar/3600;
00239   /* Compute minutes                                                                                        */
00240   TMM = (wTimeVar % 3600)/60;
00241   /* Compute seconds                                                                                        */
00242   TSS = (wTimeVar % 3600)% 60;
00243 
00244   printf("Time: %02u:%02u:%02u\r", (unsigned int)THH, (unsigned int)TMM, (unsigned int)TSS);
00245 }
00246 
00247 /*********************************************************************************************************//**
00248   * @brief  Scan an unsigned decimal number.
00249   * @return An unsigned decimal value.
00250   ***********************************************************************************************************/
00251 u32 ScanUnsignedDecimal(void)
00252 {
00253   u8 bChar = 0;
00254   u32 wNbr = 0;
00255   while (1)
00256   {
00257     bChar = getchar();
00258     if ((bChar >= '0') && (bChar <= '9'))
00259     {
00260       wNbr = (wNbr * 10) + (bChar - '0');
00261     }
00262     else
00263     {
00264       break;
00265     }
00266 
00267   }
00268   return wNbr;
00269 }

00278 void assert_error(u8* filename, u32 uline)

00281      This function is called by IP library that the invalid parameters has been passed to the library API.
00282      Debug message can be added here.
00283      Example: printf("Parameter Error: file %s on line %d\r\n", filename, uline);
00284   */
00285 
00286   while (1)
00287   {
00288   }
00289 }
